title: Can't see label if sequence begins on a newline
body:
If a sequence begins on a plain newline, its label cannot be seen and therefore it cannot be removed or edited without removing _all_ labels.

To reproduce, you can just create a sequence labeling project with default settings. Create at least one label, and import a simple document with multiple contiguous newlines in the middle, e.g.:
```
{"text": "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet\n\n\n\nconsectetur adipiscing elit."}
```

To see normal behavior, select "Lorem ipsum" and label it. See the presence of the label name. 

To see bug, select a section starting on a newline and label it. You shouldn't be able to see the label, just the underlines.

--------- 
Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows
*  Just installed latest doccano release via docker according to instructions in GitHub README
* I have tried two different Windows machines, with both Edge and Chrome browsers.
